snippet: The move settles a challenge from the hedge fund P. Schoenfeld Asset Management, which had called for a higher dividend and sale of Universal Music.
abstract: DealBook Online; Vivendi settles fight with hedge fund P Schoenfeld Asset Management by saying that it plans to raise amount it will pay to shareholders; company, which is headed by Vincent Bollore, says it will pay out 6.75 billion euros, up from 5.7 billion euros previously slated.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The move settles a challenge from the hedge fund P. Schoenfeld Asset Management, which had called for a higher dividend and sale of Universal Music.

headline.main: Vivendi, Under Pressure From Hedge Fund, Increases Payout
